articles.headline: Horns Honk, and Censors in China Get a Headache
articles.snippet: The community for users of Neihan Duanzi, a joke-sharing app, extended beyond the bounds of cyberspace. That may have angered China’s censors.
articles.abstract: The community for users of Neihan Duanzi, a joke-sharing app, extended beyond the bounds of cyberspace. That may have angered China’s censors.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — If you were driving in China recently, you might have gotten in trouble had you tried honking your car horn like this:
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong, Paul Mozur and Iris Zhao

articles.headline: Trump Proposes Rejoining Trans-Pacific Partnership
articles.snippet: The president said his advisers would look into rejoining a trade deal he withdrew from last year, as the White House tries to help farmers who will be hurt by its trade measures.
articles.abstract: The president said his advisers would look into rejoining a trade deal he withdrew from last year, as the White House tries to help farmers who will be hurt by its trade measures.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, in a sharp reversal, told a gathering of farm-state lawmakers and governors on Thursday morning that the United States was looking into rejoining a multicountry trade agreement known as the Trans-Pacific Partnership, a deal he pulled out of days after assuming the presidency.

articles.headline: Is Trump Serious About Trade War? China’s Leaders Hunt for Answers
articles.snippet: Some of the most powerful men in China have been seeking out experts to gain a better understanding of how to respond to President Trump’s combative trade agenda.
articles.abstract: Some of the most powerful men in China have been seeking out experts to gain a better understanding of how to respond to President Trump’s combative trade agenda.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — In an elegantly furnished back room at a conference in eastern China in December, a member of the Chinese leadership asked American tech executives for help.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Jane Perlez

articles.headline: Rent Control Campaign in California Is Taken to the Streets
articles.snippet: Economic pressures are fueling a drive by tenants’ rights organizers at the state and city levels to let voters enact rent regulations.
articles.abstract: Economic pressures are fueling a drive by tenants’ rights organizers at the state and city levels to let voters enact rent regulations.
articles.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — How do you get a landlord to endorse a proposal to limit rent increases?

articles.headline: Comey’s Memoir Offers Visceral Details on a President ‘Untethered to Truth’
articles.snippet: A memoir by James Comey, the former F.B.I. director, is the only firsthand account to emerge so far by a former Trump official, describing a president whose connection to honesty is tenuous at best.
articles.abstract: A memoir by James Comey, the former F.B.I. director, is the only firsthand account to emerge so far by a former Trump official, describing a president whose connection to honesty is tenuous at best.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Donald J. Trump asked Director James B. Comey of the F.B.I. to investigate and knock down a lurid but unverified report that placed Mr. Trump years earlier in a Moscow hotel suite with prostitutes, explaining to Mr. Comey that the fantastic story was untrue and was painful and distressing to his wife, Melania Trump.

articles.headline: Trump Plans to Pardon Scooter Libby for Perjury in C.I.A. Leak Case
articles.snippet: The president’s action would wipe out the perjury and obstruction convictions of Mr. Libby, who was Vice President Dick Cheney’s chief of staff.
articles.abstract: The president’s action would wipe out the perjury and obstruction convictions of Mr. Libby, who was Vice President Dick Cheney’s chief of staff.
articles.lead_paragraph: UPDATE: President Trump pardoned I. Lewis Libby Jr. on Friday. Read more »
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: British Book Publishers Fear Brexit Will Bring a U.S. Invasion
articles.snippet: A fight is looming between publishers in Britain and the United States. At stake: the lucrative European book market.
articles.abstract: A fight is looming between publishers in Britain and the United States. At stake: the lucrative European book market.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — At the opening of the London Book Fair on Tuesday, a mobile massage company set up a row of stools for anyone in need of a shoulder and neck rub. It’s been a feature of the fair for years, but the service has never seemed more timely.

articles.headline: Trump Sees Inquiry Into Cohen as Greater Threat Than Mueller
articles.snippet: As prosecutors revealed a monthslong fraud investigation of Michael D. Cohen, President Trump’s personal lawyer and fixer, Mr. Trump called Mr. Cohen on Friday to “check in.”
articles.abstract: As prosecutors revealed a monthslong fraud investigation of Michael D. Cohen, President Trump’s personal lawyer and fixer, Mr. Trump called Mr. Cohen on Friday to “check in.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s advisers have concluded that a wide-ranging corruption investigation into his personal lawyer poses a greater and more imminent threat to the president than even the special counsel’s investigation, according to several people close to Mr. Trump.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo, Michael S. Schmidt, Maggie Haberman and Eileen Sullivan

articles.headline: Trump Calls Comey ‘Untruthful Slime Ball’ as Book Details Released
articles.snippet: President Trump, who fired James B. Comey as his F.B.I. director, took to Twitter on Friday morning to disparage him as a leaker and liar.
articles.abstract: President Trump, who fired James B. Comey as his F.B.I. director, took to Twitter on Friday morning to disparage him as a leaker and liar.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — James B. Comey’s searing tell-all book was met with an aggressive counterattack on his character by President Trump and his allies on Friday, even as many Democrats struggled with conflicted feelings about the man they blame for Hillary Clinton’s loss in the 2016 election.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Alexander Burns
